comments.html: If you still want to play a game or two once in a while try sudoku. There are a few really good ones out there. I sugges sudoku because they’re a little bit more demanding. I’ve noticed that after three or four games I get tired and leave it unlike match-tree type games. It’s still enjoyable and rewarding but uch easier to quit and doesn’t take that much time.
I'm so glad you posted this. Seeing someone else struggle with their phone feels validating. I've had to ban infinite scroll microblogging apps for the same reason.

Thanks for writing this. I spend a lot of time lately in Homescapes and Souls. I just deleted ALL games from my phone except Good Soduko (I usually don't spend much time here). Got rid of Geometry, Homescapes, Warcraft Rumble, Souls, Survivor.io and The Tower. THANKS!
I go through waves of deleting TikTok for the same reason

I'm a different Alex but I have almost the same comment! The only game (or social media app) on my phone is a sudoku app which is simply not engaging enough to meet the (very low) threshold part which I get addicted to stuff. The social media i do use on my phone I use in-browser so that a) the annoyance of the UI disincentives me and b) I can use browser extensions to manage the time I spend on them. Matching games or anything with those bright colors and enticing noises utterly overwhelm my ability to turn them off.
